DOC.brief_summary: The overall goal study investigate effect daily dietary supplement brown seaweed ( 2 capsule InSea2® ) body weight , glycemic control insulin secretion overweight prediabetic men woman association moderate weight loss intervention .
DOC.brief_title: Brown Seaweed Extract Glycemic Control Body Weight
DOC.detailed_description: Diets produce low glucose insulin response may reduce diabetes cardiovascular risk . They may also facilitate weight control promote satiety , insulin sensitivity optimal insulin secretion meal . Food ingredient may indeed reduce postprandial glucose insulin response inhibition α-amylase α-glucosidase activity may slow absorption carbohydrate . InSea2® unique combination polyphenolic extract brown algae ( Ascophyllum nodosum Fucus vesiculosus ) show inhibit action α-amylase α-glucosidase . Preliminary data healthy men woman demonstrate reduce effect plasma insulin single intake InSea2® consume high-carbohydrate meal . The main objective evaluate effect daily dietary supplement 500 mg ( 2 capsule ) brown algae extract powder ( InSea2® ) blood glucose measure 2 hour oral glucose tolerance test ( OGTT ) overweight insulin-resistant men woman . The secondary objective assess contribution daily consumption supplement ( InSea2® ) weight loss associate daily caloric restriction 500 kcal due individualize nutritional intervention . More specifically , investigator aim evaluate effect supplementation combine weight loss marker glucose metabolism ( fast plasma glucose , glucose insulin response OGTT , insulin sensitivity measurement parameter insulin secretion OGTT ) , lipid profile , blood pressure metabolic syndrome criterion . The investigator expect InSea2® lower high level blood glucose insulin observe 2 hour meal overweight insulin-resistant human subject .
DOC.criteria: overweight ( BMI > 25 ; waist circumference ≥ 80cm woman ≥ 94 cm men ) fast insulin ≥ 60 pmol/L ) Impaired fast glycemia without impaired glucose tolerance HbA1c 5.6 6.4 nonsmoking stable weight past 3 month diabetes chronic disease ( thyroid dysfunction , hepatic gastrointestinal disorder , uncontrolled hypertension ) take drug could affect glucose lipid metabolism weight appetite take dietray supplement natural health product could affect glucose , lipid , weight appetite major surgery 3 month prior study past surgery digestive system pregnancy fish , seafood iodine allergy
